answers.answer: I went in for my induction on Tuesday night, they gave me cervadil to dilate me overnight...I dilated 1cm.  They started the pitocin and I slowly went from 1 to 2 then my water broke and they realized the baby had passed his meconium.  The doctor said it was probably caused by one of 2 reasons: overdue OR because I had recently had a bad fall on my stomach that they think stressed the baby out.  Then, I went from 2 to 4cm then they turned up the pitocin and I went from a 4 to an 8 in an hour!!   I got the epidural at 4cm!!!  HOWEVER the little bolus thing that you can click for more pain relief wasn't connected, so as I went from 4-8, I was in excrutiating pain!!!  They called the anesthesiologist back and he said that once pain 'runs' away with you, it is hard to get it under control and at that point, I was 10cm and they said it was better I could feel everything anyways for pushing!!!  I pushed for an hour and a half and he was out.I would choose to do it again if I were over due.  This was my first labor so I have nothing to compare it to.  I've heard that induced labors are shorter but stronger.AND by the way, I am a HUGE baby!  I have my husband hold my hand for a flu shot lolPlease don't be afraid...and get the epidural ;)
I should have clarified...I was due on a Monday...

thanks sweet...that's real bad luck with the epidural...i've had 2 epidural deliveries myself. the first worked like a dream and the second left a window of pain but definitely reduced the pain i was feeling. i'm hoping not to be induced, but if needs must...your experience will help me to cope with that.

With my DD I didnt have to be induced and had a epidural that worked wonderfully.  However with my DS it was a different story. My water had broke yet I was contracting like I should of been so they started me on pitocin. By 4cm I got an epidural. However they did not turn the pitocin down like they were supposed to. Which ended up with me having two contractions, one on top of another, without giving the baby a rest inbetween. Was to hard on him and his heart rate dropped bad enough where I had to be put on Oxygen. After that anytime we tried to push, his heart rate would drop again. It was a long scary process. Everything eventually worked out and he was a healthy baby boy for 2 yrs. :)Will I ever get pitocin again? Not a chance.  But please keep in mind everyones pregnancy/ body is different. I had friends that were induced and everything went GREAT!!! :)

I guess you need a doctor who knows what they are doing lol  They even turned my pitocin down for awhile while I was going so fast 4-8cm in an hour!  It took hours to get to 4 then I was like BAM-8cm!  Then 8-10 came even faster!Like I said, I'd do it again.  BUT everyone is different so I'm sure there are people like me and people like jlankford09 who wouldn't...But, don't be scared!  Be excited!!!  You are meeting your baby!

I agree with sweetangel... be excited to meet that sweet baby!!!Sweetangel.. i hate to say it but thats just it, I think I had a doc that didnt know what the heck they were doing.  Thats what I get for moving from Texas to Oklahoma in the last trimester. LOL.  I had the same doc in the delivery room up until the last hr. Then they did a freakin Shift Change!!!

I was induced at 6am.  Going into it I was barely a finger tip dilated but cervix was getting soft.  By 8am I was 3cm and my doctor broke my water.  Around 1045 or so I got the epidural.  I was about 8cm by 12:30m and they had to turn down the pitocin because my contractions were getting too close together, too quick - they told me there was no need for them to be that close together at this point.  At 1:30pm I was fully dilated.  My daughter was still sitting really high, so I had to push for 2 hours, but she came into this world at 3:28pm.Part of me wishes I was able to go on my own, when my body was ready, but I had mild preeclampsia so had to be induced.  I had a very good experience.  I also would get the epidural again, in a heartbeat.  I probably could have done it on my own, but I think I was taken aback by the pain.  I had immediate contractions after my water broke and I think I thought that pain would come gradually.  My sister on the other hand, was induced the same way as me and she didn't have any painful contractions until an hour after getting her water broken.  My sister also went from 3cm to 5cm right after getting her water broken and within 30 minutes of that was at 9 1/2cm.  They believe the epidural helped her relax and dilate proprly.  Just food for thought.

Thanks for posting this question. I have posted a similar one too as i want to know if there have been ladies who have been induced but not needed to epidural. I think thats my biggest fear about induction. I really don't want the epidural for many reasons. I will tens days overdue so i guess i have no choice but to go with the flow!Thanks to all the other ladies who responded to this post.

me i was already dialated to 3 1/2 cm when i went for a check upand i was to be induced due to lack of amniotic fluidthey admitted me around 3pm and by 6pm i was already having contractionsso i got an epiduralthey broke my water at midnightand they just kept checking me through out the nightby 6am i was fully dialated and started pushingand didnt have my son till 11:58 ami dont really member all the details except i was pushing forever and i was almost gon have to have a c-sectionbut from how bad everyone makes it sound it wasnt really all that bad i didnt really feel anything after the epidural-thank goodness!!!!so hopefully this labor is just as easy except pushing timei would like that to be alot shorter lolbut good luck with everythingi would kinda rather be inducedrather than me go in labor out of no where lol

I'm being induced tomorrow morning at 7am. I am really nervous. I will be 12 days overdue. I keep having a battle with myself whether I gave my body enough time to do it on my own. But I have not have any progress in three weeks. I am only 1/2 cm and 50% effaced. I really hope the induction works and I dont have a c-section. I am really healthy and so is my baby. I have worked out my whole pregnancy so I'm hoping that will help somehow. But I am still really nervous. Any words of encouragement will be appreciated. I go in today to get the foley catherdar placed. Hopefully that will start something. I dont have ANY contractions or pain, whatsoever. Just didnt think this was the way in would all go down. But I am so overdue and with NO signs so it probably is best.
everyone will be rooting for you marrisa, i'm sure it will all be fine. i'm soooo impatient to meet my little baby boy now that i kinda wish i was getting induced - right now lol.

I was a week and a half "late" by my doctor's calculations, so I was induced.  I truly had a really great birth experience, even if we had to "force" Jaiden out!  I was going to copy/paste my birth story into the forum, but it's pretty long.  So if you just wanna check out my blog: http://jessaknight.blogspot.com/2009/01/jaidens-birth-story.html, you can read all about it.From my own experience, I can tell you being induced was not the big, scary thing I thought it was going to be.  Neither was getting an epidural!  So don't get yourself too worked up over it because after it's all said and done, you'll be holding your baby!!

well i think about it now and it wasn't too bad. I was to meet the dr at the hospital at 8am and i got there and they were very busy..i was asked to sit and relax...my BP was out the roof..i couldnt relax..who can when ur about to be a mommy lol...so anyways around 12 the dr finally came in and broke my water...nothing happened...after walking for 4 hours and leaking alot of fluid i was finally put on the pitocin at 4pm...that sucked...after 5 minutes my contractions came in at 3 minutes apart lasting 45seconds and within 15 minutes or so maybe half an hour they were a minute apart lasting about 55seconds or longer..i wasnt keeping track...i was sitting in the rocking chair the whole time. around 730 i just wanted to lay down after i went for a pee..my bum was so sore from sitting on a harm rocking chair in labour for so long...around 830 i asked the nurse if i could have something for the pain anyways..a csection i remember asking..lol but the dr and nurses said no..of course...but told me i could get an epidural...it finally began having effect around 930...i fell asleep for abour half an hour(prior to this they checked my progress n i was at a 3 and 75% effaced...i had been 2cm 50% effaced for 4 weeks) so i was starting to get scared around 10ish i woke up and let them know i had an intense pressure and they would not check me.. finally at 11pm, the nurse came to empty my bladder(keeping in mind i had not peed since 730) the nurse could get the catheter in and when she went to get help from another nurse, she asked if she had checked me and said no i wouldnt be dilated and when the nurse checked i was fully dilated...so finally at 1120something i was allowed to start pushing..my son crowned immediately...at 1140 went to the delivery room and 1146 he was born...

Well my induction started jul 3 at 9 they pu a jell in that was to help soften my cervix over night. I left the hospital at 2:30. I had to call the hospital july4th to see what time they wanted me to come in so I did and they asked me to come in right away. My induction started off at 8:30 I was already 70-80% effaced from the jell and only half a centimeter dilated. They quickly turned up the pitocin in about a 3-4 hour timespan and my contractions were about 2-3 mins apart. They attempted to break my water when I was a centimeter dilated but that didn't work. They came back around 2 and broke my water. The contractions hurt but they weren't bad at all. I dilated to 3 cm then 4 theb 5 cm by 8 that night and I was tired because I got little sleep the night before and they didn't think I would have him until about 8 the next morning so they wanted me to get sleep but I wasn't able to sleep though the contractions since like 2 that afternoon so they gave me the option of getting the epidural( which I didn't want or need) now or get it later before a c section because they thought I would be to exhausted to push him out and I didn't want a c section so I got the epidural it didn't work so they had the guy come and give me another dose and like an hour later I was feeling pain in my back on the left side so I didn't tell them till 11 though so he came back and gave me another dose and then my night nurse checked me at 12:30  and told me I was complete and he the baby was already at the perineum. I pushed for 25 minutes and out came my little boy at 1:06am July 5th weighing 9lbs 7 oz 21 inches long. I loved it he only part that I hated was the epidural

I was induced for my 2nd pregnancy. The only problem I had with whole process was who they had to give me my epidural. He tried 3 times and said if he didn't get it on the 4th try I wouldn't be able to have it. During my 1st pregnancy the dr got it on the first try! Anyway, neither of my labors were that long. The first time the nurse said it would be at least another hour... about 10 minutes later our DD was born. And just about the same thing with the induced one. I mean the our DR just made it to the room during both births. The second birth seemed easier than the first so I figure this time around #3 will be even easier. Another funny thing is that both our DD's were born at 11:59am and 11:57am. I had went to the hospital at around midnight for our 1st baby and arrived at the hospital for induction at 6am the 2nd time. Maybe this one will be born 11:55am...Also I was only 2 days past my due date, but our DD was 8lb 6oz. Oh, and our 1st was born right on her due date.

I was induced with my son coz i was 6 days past my due date...i was in labor within 2 hrs and was in pain for the rest of 6 hrs when i took an epidural....at that time I was 5 cm dilated.....after that I slept for 3 and a half hrs. after which the doc discovered that I was full dilated....so the last 5 cm was painless for me..thanx to the epidural....my pushing period was a lil high...2 and a half hrs.....thats because my nurse wasn't being able to guide me properly with my breathing while I was pushing...then came an experienced nurse and my son came out in minutes....so induction went quite well

I was induced with DS and it was actually a great experience!I had cervadil inserted at 6pm.  By 10pm, I was having mild cramping.  I went to bed and woke up at 3am with more intense pain in my lower back....but nothing that bad, really.  DH started timing when the pains would come and we determined I must be having contractions (it didn't feel anything like how I thought it would).By 5am, I was bleeding slightly so we called maternity triage and were told to come in.  They had me walk the halls for awhile while they prepared to admit me.  By 9am, I was in a room and had the pitocin drip going.  Contractions weren't that bad - I could talk through them - and I was only 1cm dilated.My OB came in around 2pm and broke my water....Once that happened, things really got going.  I had intense back labour.  I tried Demerol for the pain first but it just made me vomit during the contractions and drowsy in between.  Finally, I had the epidural (I think I was about 3cm dilated by then)  and it worked like a charm!!!  I was having monster contractions but couldn't feel a thing!!  I even got to catch a little nap while they waited for me to dilate completely.By 9:30pm that same day, I was pushing - it took less than half an hour for DS to come out (once we were forcing him out, he was coming....FAST!)

my labor was induced because my water never actually broke. It had been leaking a very tiny bit for over a day or so. Ironically i had saw my doctor and he said it wasnt amniotic fluid its all his fault that i had to get it induced. If he had realized that it was indeed amniotic fluid i probably would have been spared hours of pitocin. Either way, i ended up going to hospital and they began inducing my labor. I had pitocin with no epidural. As you can imagine it was painful. I was extremely tired, but i had opted against the epidural because i hate needles. So i was in labor for about 18 long hours. Gave birth to a 6.6lb baby girl and they continued the pitocin after the labor which was very uncomfotable. It causes contractions. Yes even after birth. they do this to prevent hemorrhaging i believe.
